document.heading: Securities Act Amendments, Personnel Act Clarification, and Voluntary Retirement Act of 1980

history.narrative: Law 3-133, the “Securities Act Amendments, Personnel Act Clarification, and Voluntary Retirement Act of 1980,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 3-273, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Consumer Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 29, 1980, and September 16, 1980, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 2, 1980, it was assigned Act No. 3-254 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
